messages: d3ca5dde60f88db606021eeba2499c02 (08:19): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: the point of voting is to get an idea of what the opinions are? W3C's goal is not democratic majority rule, it's consensus building :)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:20): sure, but if you have a vote and 50 people say "no" and 2 people say "yes", deciding that that means going the "yes" route is clearly not building consensus
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:21): it's building discontent, if anything
d3ca5dde60f88db606021eeba2499c02 (08:21): right
d3ca5dde60f88db606021eeba2499c02 (08:21): but I don't think any such decision has been made
d3ca5dde60f88db606021eeba2499c02 (08:22): what I see is a 47-10 disagreement, not consensus, and the will to keep exploring both leads
d3ca5dde60f88db606021eeba2499c02 (08:22): if Dan was to force the minority solution, yeah that would probably be an issue, I agree
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:22): "The possibility of changing our charter was also not popular but Chris and I feel some obligation to pursue it regardless" -- 2 vs 34, the 2s have it
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (08:22): really? have the chairs shown any will to *not* open the rechartering process?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:22): -- http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Member/w3c-html-cg/2007OctDec/0174.html
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (08:22): or to even consider that?
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (08:22): or to come up with some compromise?
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (08:23): how is any of this consensus building?
d3ca5dde60f88db606021eeba2499c02 (08:23): I don't know enough context, but I read "feel obligation" not "feel like"
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (08:24): I've seen them ask Members who asked for charter changes what changes they want
d3ca5dde60f88db606021eeba2499c02 (08:24): not the smartest thing to put it to the vote if there are some process rules that oblige them, granted
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (08:24): I haven't seem them talk to Members who oppose charter changes to explain their reasoning
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (08:24): I don't believe any process rule obliges them to recharter
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (08:24): and I don't believe that is their claim
d3ca5dde60f88db606021eeba2499c02 (08:25): has Dan explained what makes him "feel obliged"?
d3ca5dde60f88db606021eeba2499c02 (08:25): or have you asked him to detail his rationale
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (08:25): both on this channel and privately
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (08:25): all he said is that we need Microsoft's and IBM's support

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:26): oliver: ok, more concretely: "Release "HTML 5" specification as a W3C Working Draft?" 43 yes vs 6 no, yet "Chris Wilson and I decided the question does not carry"
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (08:26): didn't explain how to do that without losing existing support
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:26): d3ca5dde60f88db606021eeba2499c02: http://www.w3.org/2002/09/wbs/40318/wd11spec/results and http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/www-archive/2007Nov/0097.html
d3ca5dde60f88db606021eeba2499c02 (08:26): that sounds regrettable
d3ca5dde60f88db606021eeba2499c02 (08:26): indeed
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (08:26): I've even made specific compromise proposals on publishing the spec and the charter issue
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (08:27): such as setting a future date for FPWD to give extra time for patent review
d3ca5dde60f88db606021eeba2499c02 (08:29): really has too little knowledge of the context to comment much, but it does sound like an annoying situation
d3ca5dde60f88db606021eeba2499c02 (08:29): I think I understand Dan's wish to keep everyone aboard, but one can't please all at the same time :/
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:29): well he's currently risking losing the most active participants
d3ca5dde60f88db606021eeba2499c02 (08:30): yes, I see that. The most active are probably also the ones with more good will to make temporary compromises
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:31): well we'll see. he said he'd give us a binding timetable for when we'd publish the current spec as a FPWD before thursday 20th
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:31): so that's what i'm waiting for before making any decisions on what to do next.
d3ca5dde60f88db606021eeba2499c02 (08:32): sighs... patents are always a tough pill to swallow
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (08:33): I don't see that there is any patent issue here
d3ca5dde60f88db606021eeba2499c02 (08:33): the key issue is the patent review upon publication of a FPWD, isn't it?
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (08:33): other than the fact that patent review won't start until we publish FPWD
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (08:34): it's unclear to me how not having that patent review serves any purpose
d3ca5dde60f88db606021eeba2499c02 (08:34): I think the point is to make sure that everyone does that review
d3ca5dde60f88db606021eeba2499c02 (08:35): if a major actor stays out of the WG during that review, that would be a serious risk
d3ca5dde60f88db606021eeba2499c02 (08:35): but that's just my immediate understanding of the problem
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (08:35): a greater risk than not having the review?
d3ca5dde60f88db606021eeba2499c02 (08:35): or is there more I'm missing?
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (08:35): I really don't know
d3ca5dde60f88db606021eeba2499c02 (08:35): a greater risk than having the review later, or giving more time for it
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (08:36): I've proposed a defined amount of extra review time
d3ca5dde60f88db606021eeba2499c02 (08:36): not having the review would be terrible, IMHO
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (08:36): a Member can always leave temporarily and return on completion of their review
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (08:36): changing the charter has no effect on review
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (08:36): so it seems to be just a procedural delay tactic

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:36): yeah that seems to me to be the most optimal way of doing it -- just have any members who need more than 3 months to do their patent review leave the group temporarily
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:37): otherwise we just slow down all the other players
d3ca5dde60f88db606021eeba2499c02 (08:39): that'd be a solution, I guess.
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (08:41): I also proposed extra time before publishing to allow review of the actual FPWD without anyone having to leave, as long as the amount of time is predefined
